title: \*\*Please can you help?\*\*
content:
Hi guys my name is Samuel Burn and im working in Bristol. Im new to this forum but forgive me for my first post being a request!!  
Does anyone know the name of the typographer who made the snowflake a few years ago made completely from type? I can remember how its looked but am at a loss as to who made it!  
Would be grateful for any suggestions

Thanks Sam
author: samuelburn

comments.content:
Well, while we are being flaky, I thought I would post a snowflake I drew a few years ago for an orchestra client. It is made from musical drawings.

ChrisL

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018080806im_/http:/typophile.com/files/snowflakeMusic.gif)
dezcom, I love that! Very clever.
Normally I'd say you were tooting your own horn, but you bowed me over with that one.
Chris that is brilliant, it must of looked great in silver.

<cite>Normally I’d say you were tooting your own horn, but you bowed me over with that one.</cite>

No pun about the f-holes?

- Lex

"No pun about the f-holes?"

That would have tempted Steve to have said "f-u" to me :-)  
Of course, he is too much of a gentlemen for that. On the hole, he would have stopped f-ing. :-)  
[that last one is a real musicians joke]

ChrisL
